rComments: Take admin law with Piper. He provides you with the frameworks and uses plenty of examples to ensure we understand. Nothing will make sense until the last few weeks of the class, and that's OKAY. I met him after class and asked him to teach me procedural fairness from the beginning because I genuinely thought I would fail, he was so helpful!!

Even though admin law is (at least at the moment) a very confusing, difficult area of the law, he breaks it down really well and gives students the tools to understand, apply and remember admin law decisions. Goes through examples, practice tests and decision trees in class. Never read the cases and still did alright, haha.

He's new to teaching and it really shows. He relies far too much on his power point slides and does a terrible job of explaining concepts in class. He did not adequately prepare us for the exam, and the exam seemed to be a huge leap from what we learned in class and in the materials. Would not take a class with him again.

Prof. Piper could slow down and sometimes goes into too much detail, but he gives great slides, flowcharts to help understand the material and uses survey questions to break up the lecture. For the first time teaching the course, he was great.

Thought he seemed like a nice guy, but he wasn't really the most effective teacher. He did a poor job of preparing us for the exam, and was inconsistent with his feedback and other things. Admin law is tough, and I did well (B), but I wouldn't take a class with him again.
Another annoying leftist prof at University of Ottawa. Doesn't teach clearly, and likes to provide tons of examples that don't make any sense.

Admin is hard, but he made it palatable. Very clear, engaging, attuned to reality. Teaches from perspective of a practitioner. Uses constructive learning techniques (w/o burying us in podcasts and weekly assignments). Great use of real-time survey questions to test understanding. Made learning fun again. (Written pre-grading of assignment & exam).
Awful. Should not be teaching. Poorly organized and annoying.

For a first time prof, I think he did a solid job. Great powerpoint slides that went over lots of the key points, super helpful! Was accessible outside of class and tried his best to answer questions and follow up. Test was a bit hard and the paper graded hard, but overall a good experience!
